alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hancock, southwestern Henderson, southeastern Henry, southwestern Des Moines, southeastern Van Buren, Lee and northeastern Clark Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Croton, or 10 miles north of Kahoka, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Donnellson around 200 PM CDT. Franklin and New Boston around 205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fort Madison, West Point, Denmark, Dallas City, Middletown, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant, West Burlington and Burlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
